snippet: Manufacturing in the United States shrank in November to its weakest level since July 2009, a private survey showed.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management reports manufacturing in the United States shrank in November to its weakest level since July 2009; index falls to 49.5 from 51.7 in October; Commerce Dept says construction spending rose 1.4 percent in October.
lead_paragraph: Manufacturing in the United States shrank in November to its weakest level since July 2009, a private survey showed.

headline.main: Manufacturing Declines to Weakest Level Since July 2009
headline.print_headline: Manufacturing Declines to Weakest Level Since July 2009
